overview: Jeremiah prophesied during Judah's final decades, warning of coming judgment while weeping for his people. Called 'the weeping prophet,' he also promised a new covenant written on hearts.

verses.text: For I know the plans I have for you, declares the LORD, plans for welfare and not for evil, to give you a future and a hope.

For this is the covenant that I will make with the house of Israel after those days, declares the LORD: I will put my law within them, and I will write it on their hearts. And I will be their God, and they shall be my people.
Call to me and I will answer you, and will tell you great and hidden things that you have not known.
The heart is deceitful above all things, and desperately sick; who can understand it?

passages.title: The Call of Jeremiah
passages.summary: God calls Jeremiah from before birth, promising to be with him despite his youth and the opposition he will face.

passages.title: The New Covenant
passages.summary: God promises a new covenant unlike the old—His law written on hearts, sins forgiven, and intimate knowledge of Him.

passages.title: Letter to the Exiles
passages.summary: Jeremiah writes to those already in Babylon, telling them to settle in, pray for the city, and wait for God's timing.

facts.text: Jeremiah 29:11 was written to exiles in Babylon, promising restoration after 70 years—not immediate deliverance.
Jeremiah was forbidden to marry, as a sign that normal life was ending for Judah (Jeremiah 16:2).
The 'new covenant' Jeremiah prophesied is what Jesus established at the Last Supper (Luke 22:20).
Jeremiah's scribe Baruch wrote down his prophecies. The scroll was burned by King Jehoiakim, so they rewrote it with additions.

figures.name: Jeremiah
figures.description: The 'weeping prophet' who served faithfully for 40 years despite rejection, persecution, and seeing his warnings come true.

figures.name: Baruch
figures.description: Jeremiah's faithful scribe and secretary who recorded his prophecies and shared in his sufferings.

figures.name: Jehoiakim
figures.description: An evil king who burned Jeremiah's scroll piece by piece, showing contempt for God's word.

videos.title: Jeremiah Overview
videos.description: The Bible Project explores the weeping prophet's message of judgment and hope.
